title: ISSS608 - Visual Analytics and Applications
text:
The future of analytics



Welcome to ISS608 - Visual Analytics and Applications, AY2024/2025 Jan class!
This page documents my learning journey of creating data visualization beyond default, using R and Tableau.This is part of the ISSS608 course by SMU MITB program, by Prof Kam Tin Seong
If you have any feedback or need any clarification, you may contact me at andrea.yeo.2023@mitb.smu.edu.sg
I hope you enjoy it!














In-Class Exercise
Hands-on Exercise
Take-home Exercise

title: About
text:
In this webpage, you will find my learning journey and deliverables of ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications. I am Godzilla. This is the course page of ISSS608 whereby I share my Hands-on Exercises, In-class Exercises, Take-Home Exercises and Project
Do Linkledin page, and brief introduction ```

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Loading tidyverse onto r environment by using the code chunk below

pacman:: p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Loading tidyverse onto r environment by using the code chunk below

pacman:: p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Importing Data
Code chunk below uses read_csv() of readr to import REALIS2019.csv into r environment as a tibble data.frame.

realis2019 <- read_csv("data/REALIS2019.csv")
popdata_fat <- read_csv("data/PopData2019_fat.csv")

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Pivoting Data

#pivot_longer() "lengthens" data, increasing the number of rows and decreasing the number of columns

popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>% #pipe: to combine diff functions tgt
  pivot_longer(c(3:21), #column
               names_to = "Age Group", #column headers to rows
               values_to = "Population") #values to rows


write_rds(popdata_long, "rds/popdata_long.rds") #rds: compact r file

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Selecting Data

realis2019_selected <- realis2019 %>%
  select(`Project Name`,
         `Transacted Price ($)`,
         `Type of Sale`,
         `Unit Price ($ psm)`,
         `Property Type`)
realis2019_selected

# A tibble: 19,515 × 5
   `Project Name`     `Transacted Price ($)` `Type of Sale` `Unit Price ($ psm)`
   <chr>                               <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>
 1 PEIRCE VIEW                        840000 Resale                         7434
 2 FLORIDA PARK                      3040000 Resale                         9737
 3 BULLION PARK                       860000 Resale                        11467
 4 CASTLE GREEN                      1000000 Resale                         9346
 5 HAPPY ESTATE                      7000000 Resale                        10183
 6 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2880000 Resale                        12659
 7 THE PANORAMA                      1510000 Resale                        16064
 8 THE PANORAMA                       710000 Resale                        16905
 9 CHIP THYE GARDEN                  2800000 Resale                        13500
10 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2300000 Resale                         9935
# ℹ 19,505 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: `Property Type` <chr>

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Filtering Data using dplyr package

realis2019_filtered <- realis2019_selected %>%
  filter (`Property Type` == "Condominium" |
            `Property Type` == "Apartment") %>%
  filter (`Type of Sale` == "New Sale") %>%
  filter (`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)

realis2019_filtered

# A tibble: 87 × 5
   `Project Name`     `Transacted Price ($)` `Type of Sale` `Unit Price ($ psm)`
   <chr>                               <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>
 1 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1029000 New Sale                      12863
 2 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                 871000 New Sale                      12809
 3 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1940000 New Sale                      12848
 4 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1030000 New Sale                      12875
 5 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                2061000 New Sale                      12962
 6 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                 762000 New Sale                      12915
 7 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1001000 New Sale                      12513
 8 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1271000 New Sale                      12838
 9 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1310000 New Sale                      12970
10 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1339000 New Sale                      13000
# ℹ 77 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: `Property Type` <chr>



Putting all together

realis2019_end <- realis2019 %>%
  select(`Project Name`,
         `Transacted Price ($)`,
         `Type of Sale`,
         `Unit Price ($ psm)`,
         `Property Type`)   %>%
  filter (`Property Type` == "Condominium" |
            `Property Type` == "Apartment") %>%
  filter (`Type of Sale` == "New Sale") %>%
  filter (`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)

realis2019_end

# A tibble: 87 × 5
   `Project Name`     `Transacted Price ($)` `Type of Sale` `Unit Price ($ psm)`
   <chr>                               <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>
 1 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1029000 New Sale                      12863
 2 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                 871000 New Sale                      12809
 3 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1940000 New Sale                      12848
 4 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1030000 New Sale                      12875
 5 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                2061000 New Sale                      12962
 6 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                 762000 New Sale                      12915
 7 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1001000 New Sale                      12513
 8 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1271000 New Sale                      12838
 9 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1310000 New Sale                      12970
10 RIVERFRONT RESIDE…                1339000 New Sale                      13000
# ℹ 77 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: `Property Type` <chr>


Notes: eval (display the code but does not run it), echo (runs the code but does not display it), %>% (used to combine multiple functions together)
#Change environmental variables if needed

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: Working with tidyverse
text:
Working with dplyr

realis2019_selected <- realis2019 %>% 
  select(`Project Name`, 
         `Transacted Price ($)`, 
         `Property Type`,
         `Type of Sale`,
         `Unit Price ($ psm)`) 
realis2019_selected

# A tibble: 19,515 × 5
   `Project Name`          `Transacted Price ($)` `Property Type` `Type of Sale`

title: Hands-on-Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
working with filter() of dplyr

realis2019_filtered <- realis2019_selected %>% 
  filter(`Property Type` =="Condominium" | 
           `Property Type`== "Apartment") %>% 
  filter(`Type of Sale` == "New Sale") %>% 
  filter(`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)


Putting all together

realis2019_selected <- realis2019 %>% 
  select(`Project Name`, 
         `Transacted Price ($)`, 
         `Type of Sale`,
         `Unit Price ($ psm)`,
         `Property Type`) %>% 
  filter(`Property Type` =="Condominium" | 
           `Property Type`== "Apartment") %>% 
  filter(`Type of Sale` == "New Sale") %>% 
  filter(`Unit Price ($ psm)` <= 13000)
